name: date-hover-preview
description: Preview date timestamps in a little hover popup with configurable timezones and formats

date-hover-preview.detect.ISO-8601String.markdownDescription: Whether to detect [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format date string when hovering.

date-hover-preview.detect.unixTime.markdownDescription: Whether to detect Unix epoch time when hovering. Currently supports 9-10 digits (as seconds) or up to 14 digits (as milliseconds).

date-hover-preview.primaryPreview.name.markdownDescription: Show as the name of primary preview section.

date-hover-preview.primaryPreview.format.markdownDescription: Primary date preview format, described in [day.js format documentation](https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format). Leave empty to use ISO-8601 format.

date-hover-preview.primaryPreview.utcOff.markdownDescription: UTC offset for the primary preview expressed as a number of hours between -16 and 16 (any number outside of that range will be interpreted as minutes).

date-hover-preview.primaryPreview.timezo.markdownDescription: Timezone for the primary preview. Timezones are expressed like "America/Los_Angeles". This setting will take precedence over `#date-hover-preview.primaryPreview.utcOffset#`. If both are left blank this will use your local timezone. For a list of timezones, see the [TZ database name column](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones).

date-hover-preview.additionalPreviews.markdownDescription: Additional previews can be configured in settings.json. Use intellisense to discover possible fields.

name.description: Show as the name of this additional preview.

format.description: Used to format preview display. Leave empty to use ISO-8601 format.

utcOffset.description: UTC offset expressed as a number of hours between -16 and 16 (any number outside of that range will be interpreted as minutes).

timezone.description: Timezones are expressed like "America/Los_Angeles". This setting will take precedence over utcOffset. If both are left blank this will use your local timezone.
